conclusion: The process from C to D is an isochoric (constant volume) process.
The diagram shows a vertical line from C to D, indicating no change in volume.
During an isochoric process, the volume does not change, so the work done by the gas is zero.
Work done is given by the area under the P-V curve, and there is no horizontal displacement in this case.
The work done externally by the gas from state C to state D is 0 Joules.
